title: Angola: Technician Highlights Use of Internet As Country's Main Technological Advance
text:
Nigeria: Africa Needs More Spectrum to Meet With the Growth of Data Services - - GSMA Director Luanda — António Calongo, a member of the International Association of Technological Industry, last Thursday highlighted the transition from telephone centres and the telegraph to the spread of the internet use in computer networks, telephone sets and in the communities as the main technological advance recorded in Angola. Speaking to ANGOP, in regard to the problems and evolution of internet in Angola, António Calongo said that the use of such technological tool in companies, schools, banking institutions shows that the country has progressed and it can evolve even more. To him, despite this evolution, it is necessary to more investment in the technological domain for better adaptation to the present moment where the internet plays a significant role in people's daily lives. "The internet services must be used as a necessity and not as a luxury thing, so as to avoid the vulnerabilities that are subject to the new technologies due to economic, political and social reasons", emphasised the source.
